Description: Terracotta figure bust of a goddess (Aphrodite?) with wavy hair, wearing high crown. The lower register is ornamented with two sea horses confronting; between them a large round dot. In top of crown small round perforation. Mould-made with an open back. Traces of a light slip or paint. Red-brown fabric, possibly Nile silt (?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Database lists this as probably from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.224) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
